Module onethreeseven.stosem
Package onethreeseven.stosem.model.markov

Class HMMTrellis

  • java.lang.Object
    • onethreeseven.stosem.model.markov.HMMTrellis

  • public class HMMTrellis
extends java.lang.Object
    This structure is used to find the Viterbi path through a hidden markov model. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Viterbi_algorithm

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HMMTrellis​(MarkovState rootState, MarkovState[] firstObservationStates, boolean onlyExtendMostLikely, int keepTopN)
      Create the Hidden Markov Model trellis starting with a root state.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HMMTrellis

        public HMMTrellis​(MarkovState rootState,
                  MarkovState[] firstObservationStates,
                  boolean onlyExtendMostLikely,
                  int keepTopN)
        Create the Hidden Markov Model trellis starting with a root state. The root state is not a real internal state, but is used to determine the probabilities of the initial states. In a traditional HMM this is equivalent to passing in the starting probabilities. But in our representation the starting probabilities are simply the transition probabilities resolve this root state to the initial states.
        Parameters:
        rootState - The state which determines the starting probabilities.
        firstObservationStates - The potential states for the first observation.
        onlyExtendMostLikely - only extend most likely (is faster but much less accurate)
        keepTopN - if not extending most likely how many paths should the model keep

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public boolean insert​(MarkovState curNode)
        Inserts a given markov state in the HMM trellis.
        Parameters:
        curNode - The state/observation to store in the HMM trellis at this level.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the insertion was possible (if it has -infinity probability it is not possible).

      • moveToNextState

        public void moveToNextState​()
        Prepares the tree for the next set of insertions.

      • setKeepTopN

        public HMMTrellis setKeepTopN​(int keepTopN)
        Controls how many nodes are kept during pruning. Increase this number to make the model more thorough (but slower). The default value is 10.
        Parameters:
        keepTopN - How many potential paths to keep.
        Returns:
        A reference to this class, for method chaining.

      • setOnlyExtendMostLikely

        public HMMTrellis setOnlyExtendMostLikely​(boolean onlyExtendMostLikely)

      • getViterbiPath

        public java.util.List<MarkovState> getViterbiPath​()
        Returns:
        The most likely set of sequences through the trellis based on the states inserted into it.
